Package ca.uqac.lif.cep.functions

Definition of the Function object and basic concepts around functions.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    And
    Implementation of the logical conjunction
    ArgumentPlaceholder
    Symbol standing for the i-th trace given as input
    BinaryFunction<T,V,U>
    Function of two inputs and one output
    Constant
    Representation of a unary constant
    ConstantProcessor
    Function processor returning a constant value.
    ContextAssignment  
    ContextPlaceholder
    Placeholder for the value of a context element
    CumulativeFunction<T>
    A function with memory.
    CumulativeProcessor
    Creates a cumulative processor out of a cumulative function.
    EmlBoolean  
    Equals
    Checks for the equality of various data types
    Function
    Represents a stateless m-to-n function.
    FunctionCollator
    Applies a function to a input events from one or more traces.
    FunctionProcessor
    Applies a function to input events to produce output events.
    FunctionTree
    A tree of n-ary functions composed together
    Negation
    Implementation of the logical negation
    Or
    Implementation of the logical disjunction
    PackageExtension
    Palette object for the processor included in this package.
    PassthroughFunction
    Delegates all calls of the Function class to an internal object instantiated by a method.
    SimpleFunction  
    UnaryFunction<T,U>
    Function of one input and one output

Package ca.uqac.lif.cep.functions Description

Definition of the Function object and basic concepts around functions. This package also defines a few commonly used functions, such as equality and Boolean connectives.
Author:
Sylvain Hallé
